sentence.Network_en: He had not been entirely clearheaded when the chateau gates snapped shut behind him.
sentence.Network_cn: 当大别墅的门在他身后“啪”地关上的时候,他的头脑还没清醒过来.

sentence.Network_en: Are these measures geared at havingall player show up clearheaded at training?
sentence.Network_cn: 这些措施有没有让球员们在训练中精神起来?

sentence.Network_en: You should be a clearheaded and calm.

entry.tran: (尤指在困难形势下)头脑清楚的，清醒的，明事理的
entry.def: If you describe someone as clear-headed, you mean that they are sensible and think clearly, especially in difficult situations.

example.ex: ...his clear-headed grasp of the laws of economics.
example.tran: 他对经济规律的清楚把握

means.word_mean: 1. not mentally confused; able to think clearly and act intelligently
